description:
This course provides the minimum mathematical requirements to study mathematical finance or more precisely the pricing of financial derivatives.

                                            Syllabus
                        Week 1:Basic ProbabilityInteresting problems in probablityRandom variables,distribution functions and independenceChebyshev inequality,Borel-Cantelli lemmas and related issuesLaw of Large Numbers and Central Limit TheoremWeek 2:Conditional ExpectationMartingalesBrownian MotionWeek 3:Deterministic vs random differential equationStochastic IntegralsIto CalculusWeek 4:Stochastic Differential Equations:Definitions and ExamplesProperties of the solution of stochastic differential equations
title: Probability and Stochastics for finance
